title: Function
text: The brainstem controls critical involuntary functions that keep you alive, including breathing, heart rate, blood pressure, swallowing, and sleep cycles.

title: Connecting Brain and Body
text: All sensory and motor signals traveling between your brain and the rest of your body pass through the brainstem, making it your nervous system's main highway.

title: Oldest Brain Structure
text: The brainstem is evolutionarily ancient and nearly identical in all vertebrates, highlighting its fundamental importance for survival.

title: Relevance
text: Damage to the brainstem can be life-threatening. It can lead to brain death, a coma, paralysis, disruption of breathing, cardiovascular collapse, severe impairments to senses, cognitive issues, and more.
